themes: need for transparency in grant programs
accessibility challenges for small organizations and individual artists
importance of cultural and geographic diversity in funding
support for historically underserved communities (BIPOC, queer, disability-centered)
barriers due to lack of grant-writing experience and administrative support
call for multi-year funding and capacity-building support
key_phrases: focus on transparency, accessibility, and long-term impact
grants are vital tools for cultural equity
intentional refinement to truly meet the needs of our creative ecosystem
smaller organizations and individual artists don’t have grant-writing experience or administrative support
streamlining the application, offering multilingual resources, and providing one-on-one assistance or workshops
funding should reflect the cultural and geographic diversity of Austin
barriers_identified: historical exclusion from traditional funding streams
solutions_proposed: prioritizing funding for historically underserved communities
ensuring funding reaches BIPOC-led, queer-led, and disability-centered organizations
capacity-building support such as marketing, space access, and fiscal mentorship
